Reviews.Title: “Great retreat”
Reviews.Author: Pickyfellow
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at AbaC during my recent trip to Barcelona after 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental. Got a good rate from a hotel site, hence decided to give it a try. Besides, I knew the restaurant is top rate. Must say that I am glad I did. The hotel is in a quiet residential area at Av Tibidabo. So no shops around, but if you want to get away noise of the city, it's a good retreat. Rooms are comfortable and nicely designed. The bathroom is really cool: a jacuzzi tub with mood lighting and separate showers and a one way glass mirror through which one can look into the bedroom (but not the other way). Service is friendly and personal. Although she speaks little English, the lady who serves breakfast every morning is so sweet. Food is superb: both creative and tasty. I suggest going for the tasting menu. I probably wouldn't recommend this to someone who's in Barcelona for the first time because of the location. But if you know Barcelona a fair bit and love food, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: rolexgozo
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from a 4 night stay. It is a very good hotel, but other 5 star hotels are better. We were the only couple there, on the 2nd day another couple arrived. There is no fitness area, so there's nothing to do except use the spa. The prices of food are ridiculously expensive so I suggest you take a cab and find a good restaurant. It's a very small hotel, away from the city centre. I booked this hotel because all the other 5 star hotels were fully booked. It's nothing compared to El palace hotel, which is in the centre. Once you've experienced El Palace, you cannot enjoy your stay anywhere else. The staff was excellent at ABaC, very professional especially the breakfast blonde lady. She's amazingly genuine. Wherever you go you need to take a cab, it's 10 minutes away from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating BD =))))”
Reviews.Author: roz a
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviews above about the hotel and accommodation and just want to add that its a really nice place I have found near the hotel - its a night disco called as Atlantic Disco. I made surprise for my couple to celebrate her Birthday with our friends))) She was extremely happy and liked the evening there! Everything was amazing! We do love it!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect relaxing weekend retreat in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NeilChapman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of being looked after by the team at ABaC in March 2012. Everything about our stay was absolutely perfect, from the warmest of welcomes, through pampering spa treatments to the exquisite food. ABac really is an oasis of calm and relaxation to which we found ourselves retreating several times a day from the hustle and bustle of the city. Oh, and Marien ... you are an angel! The Norwegians.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully accurate reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ANF1111
Reviews.Content: I rely heavily on the opinions of trip advisor to plan my stays. When I saw all of the positive feedback on this small boutique hotel I knew I had to try it. The reviews were accurate, to say the least. The small hotel (15 rooms) is wonderfully appointed, in a really lovely neighborhood, steps away from public transportation but a really nice walk to many places. The staff members focus on the guests, showing the details of the hotel and making sure your needs are met - even before you arrive. They know who you are (including the bar tender whom I had never seen before!) and they take pride in making sure you want for nothing. I was there on a Monday so I knew I would not be able to try the restaurant, but I plan to return with my husband and we will make a reservation. I travel a lot, and stay in many hotels. When I returned, I told my husband that ABaC was one of the nicest hotel experiences I have had. It was a combination of the really lovely hotel, the service, the amenities.... I really liked the rain shower, although it is a little challenging (in the room type I as in) to open the shower, turn on the water to get warm and not get the water all of the floor. Not an issue for me, but I thought I would point that out. Barcelona is one of my favorite cities and I love to visit. I am so glad that I have found the right hotel, and will go back again. This hotel deserves each of the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful setting and very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo O
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Barcelona on business and pleasure I try to stay at different hotels and Abac is one of the best. During my recent stay I was very impressed with the service, the rooms were outstanding and the restaurant was excellent. They have an extensive wine list and the setting is very relaxing. Despite the fact that it is not in the heart of Barcelona, it was not a problem as there is a subway stop across the street and cabs go by frequently. Highly recommend Abac for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: fussy-guests
Reviews.Content: For those of you who already know Barcelona, or/and don't need/ want to be right in the centre, this is a first class choice. It's a 10 minute taxi ride down to the centre, say 15 minutes to Barceloneletta. Well run and comfortable, apart from some late night room service problems, we had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design hotel at the top of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MWSWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We loved being at the top of the city, right at a subway stop, at this beautiful hotel. We had the Penthouse Suite and a regular room for our kids. The Penthouse was very beautiful and perfectly appointed with expansive bath, outdoor jacuzzi and hughe terrace with multiple sitting areas. We stay in many fine hotels, but the price of food here took your breath away. Perhaps better for couples as oppose to a family with two teenage boys. That being said, the food was amazing, the staff friendly and helpful and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful out of the way romantic getaway, but IN Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Rpierant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ABaC Hotel from shortly after Christmas through the early New Year (Jan 4, 2012), and found the staff sincerely happy about where they work, extremely hardworking, and all willing go out of their way to please their guests (and indeed made our stay as comfortable and restful as possible). From their AWESOME manager, Marien Inigo-Schneider (she is ALL about aiming to please, will not put up with incompetence and, I suspect, never sleeps!), to their front desk staff (Christina and other very capable and helpful colleagues), to the young, 2-Michelin Star chef, Jordi Cruz (a guest hallway runs right through the ABaC kitchen where you can witness this amazing restaurant in action and say hello to Jordi himself!), THIS is the hotel to stay in Barcelona. While this place is a short cab ride away from downtown Barcelona, take the Metro -- it is cheap, clean, safe, quick and enjoyable. Both the taxi stand and station are right across the street from the hotel. As for noise, there is none: ALL the windows are soundproof at the hotel, and you don't hear a sound from a minimal amount of traffic that runs by the hotel (the hotel itself is located in a nice, residential area of Barcelona). While there were some issues with the hotel being a bit too modern for its own sake (limited individual light controls, slightly complicated TV system, and some suite layouts have the bedroom before the living room area such that room service becomes somewhat awkward if you want to stay in the "privacy" of your own bed), this hotel is excellent, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking to stay in Barcelona. LOTS of hidden and well placed closet and drawer space so as not to leave you stressing over having a room with luggage laying around. NOTE: you must ask for "hand towels" if you want washcloths (it's a language issue, I think), and for a full pot of coffee (not hot water to dilute the strong coffee provided) if you are a big coffee drinker. In short, they were GREAT at meeting our many requests and attempting to understand "American" oddities (such as the large pots of strong coffee). We will definitely go there again!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at Abac !”
Reviews.Author: Domperignon59
Reviews.Content: Just had a perfect 2 night stay,smiling and efficient staff during all our stay, penthouse was fabulous with huge terrace with a lot of outside furniture and outside shower , room was full of light, with a view from everywhere, including the shower,+ enjoying sunrise from the bed at the touch of a button commanding the curtains, very clever design in bathroom + dressing. A minor problem was efficiently solved by the Guest Manager Marien, breakfast was good (not exceptional ) but the lady in charge of the breakfast took excellent care of us . We had Room service once and both (simple) dishes were perfect. The Spa is very relaxing and the massage was simply the best ever (by Lucie or Lucy ?) , and I had Banyan, Aman and Como before. When you ge back to the Hotel you can either pass through reception , or via another entrance directly to the room, you fell like if you are living in Barcelona. I didn't like the rainshower in the bathroom, I think it is nice as an addition to a "real " shower , but it can't replace the feeling of a " power shower ". Can't wait to go back to Abac Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant visit and Service of staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my family and I could not stay at the property due to needing to cater for our 15 month old son, however we had lunch in the restaurant. There was an initial error made by the hotel for the booking, but it was later corrected in a manner that exceptional. Once given the opportunity to correct their mistake, I can only say that the service and standards that this hotel displays is literally second to none. The elegance of the staff and overall property is a benchmark that other hotels should look to. The restaurant has recently earned 2 stars from Michelin. This is without a doubt the best food experience my wife and I have ever had. We dined exactly 3 weeks after eating in Daniel, a 3 star restaurant in New York. There was no comparison. Whilst Daniel was amazing, the service, imagination of the chef and everything that the restaurant surparsed Daniel. The flavours and imagination of the dishes are extrodonary. The food was art in every sense of the word. The chef...a genius. He will soon be recognised as one of the worlds best - I am certain of it. There are other words I am sure to describe this restaurant, but still a few days after visiting, I am lost for them. Make one of your afternoons or evenings a visit to this restaurant - treat it as an attraction and experience that you can rarely get in other places around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: A super modern hotel with luxurious touches such as Bang and Olufsen electronics, Hermes products, and there even is a cartridge coffee maker in the room. Since the hotel premise was locked, we actually had difficulty checking in at 1300. This was due to a malfunction of the doorbell at both entrances. The staff were super apologetic about the incident and from there our stay was good. We stayed in the Superior Room with our own large private balcony. The balcony square footage might have been bigger than the room itself. The bathroom had a separate bath with rain shower. And when I say rain shower I mean a 2 ft x 2 ft gush of water coming down from the ceiling! We did have some difficulty figuring out how to adjust the temperature, but once that was resolved it was heaven. We ate at the newly upgraded 2 Michelin star restaurant and it was absolutely divine. I have eaten at many Michelin rated restaurants, including the 3 star Per Se in New York and the ABAC restaurant might have been out best dining experience ever. In addition to the whimsical delicious food, the restaurant was able to fully accommodate my girlfriend's dietary restrictions. We only had one minor gripe that ironically has to do with the heavy sound-proofing of the hotel. The heavy and numerous doors that it takes to get to your room really isolate the sound well, however, they slam and make a loud noise after each one is opened. This means that when another guest leaves their room, especially with at an adjacent floor, we hear every door slam on their way out. I don't know how much the hotel can do to fix this but again it's just a minor detail. All in all we had a wonderful stay and we will definitely be back to the ABAC for both the stay, the warm, friendly, excellent staff, and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel and a fabulos restaurant !”
Reviews.Author: Maria263
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! The dinner was a very special experience ! Congratulations for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Yarro
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's membership of the Small Luxury Hotels group. The hotel has modern decor, friendly and efficient staff, a cool lounge and a small and excellent Michelin-starred restaurant. The breakfasts are fantastic, served by a wonderful lady - Pila(?) of Pamplona is one of those true gems that you can strike in a small hotel - and we unreservedly recommend the lightly poached egg on a base of cheese, bread crumb and potato gratin. Coffee was served without request and always as preferred - another sign of a great hotel and staff. The ABaC is not perfect - not enough towels in the room, the lounge / bar was a bit disorganized, the spa is just average and the room shower and toilet are a bit too trendy / gloomy. That said, this is one of the best small hotel experiences we have had. ABaC is located slightly out of town, although don't let this put you off - the tourist bus and Metro leave from right outside the gated walls of the hotel. Despite the busy roads surrounding the hotel, the rooms are brillliantly quiet due to good double glazing and the ultra modern appliances (B&O tv and Nespresso machine) really suit the decor. The rain-shower is a nice touch in the bathroom. Dinner in the hotel was excellent - not cheap of course, although not ridiculous - a must do experience. We left the wine selections to the sommelier and he produced some great and unusual wines by the glass. Overall the ABaC is well worth experiencing. Don't choose if it you prefer cheap, large and impersonal hotels - this is one for those seeking luxury, personal attention, great food and wine - and realistic enough to know that perfection does not come along very often.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five and not memorable”
Reviews.Author: coffeebar
Reviews.Content: ABAC hotel has a very nice property and restaurant going for it, but as it happens so many times with hotels these days, it fails to give a 5 stars experiences or a true boutique experience. To start with the more positive side of ABAC, i can tell you that it is a pretty property, and it really feels exclusive due to it having only 15 rooms and a very posh restaurant. We had 2 rooms and they were both beautiful and comfortable. The breakfast was very very good. It is served every morning by the same non English speaker lady, but she is so nice and attentive it doesnt really matter. We had dinner at the restaurant one evening to celebrate my birthday and the tasting meal was excellent and very creative and the service was also excellent, as it should be for a EUR150 per person meal, not including alcohol. For the less positive side, The showers in both our rooms had a far from good water pressure and they have a design error that makes the water leak from the shower inside the bathroom. They don't have a policy of a bell boy in the entrance. When you arrive - no one is there to welcome you and to help with your bags / shopping bags. The location is not central at all and you need a 10 min taxi drive to go to or back to the hotel. But to top it all, were these two service related incidents that really showed me the true colors of this hotel and its dissapointing service. The hotel did not acknoledge that it was my birthday in any way and did nothing at all to make this special day memorable for me. Our party had two rooms booked for 3 nights each, we spent over a EUR1000 at the restaurant and nothing at all. And when i checked in i asked the lady to charge a different card then the one i made the reservation with. She took the new card number and assured me it was done. Of course at check out i found out that this was not done and that the wrong card was charged. This took way too much time - and attitude - to correct. The dealing with Marien the hotel manager was not pleasant, and she didn't take responsibility for their error. So this is not a true class act. Next time i'll try the new and amazingly-looking Mandarin Oriental Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Timkate
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel off the beaten track. A Greta refuge from the masses and mobs in central Barcelona. We just returned and loved it. The dinner was magical! The hosts were wonderful. It's refreshing to order ice and have it delivered in minutes. Free wi-fi also. About a 10 minute ride to central Barcelona. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “First class stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lion_10
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for her birthday and we stayed in the fantastic penthouse suite which came complete with it's own private terrace overlooking the mountains and outdoor jacuzzi. Staff are excellent and we were welcomed in from the heat of Barcelona with a glass of Cava whilst we checked in. We were given a full and detailed tour of the hotel and it's facilities as well as getting help booking tickets for the sagrada familia and printing our boarding passes. We ate in the restaurant on the first night which is a great experience and the service was faultless. One good tip is to sign up to the small luxury hotels of the world club (this is free) and then book the hotel room through there as you get free breakfast every morning with the membership. Ours was brought to our terrace complete with table linen and everything we needed. Taxis are surprisingly reasonable in Barca and the trip to the airport is €25 (although beware the hotel's transfer service is around €80 as it's limousine service). Rooms have iPads and B&O TVs but it would be nice if they could include an iPod dock or AppleTV to allow music and films to be played through the system. Mini-bar is predictably expensive and as has been commented previously, the room service menu is abysmal for a hotel of this standard. We used it once - had two chicken burgers which arrived with no bun and were of the quality you would expect from a Lidl freezer cabinet. Still, none of this is enough to detract from what is a fantastic hotel. Park Guell is a 20min walk, the old tram stops right outside to go to Mt Tibidabo and the Av Tibidabo metro station is right opposite and takes 15mins into the centre of town (although it only runs every 15mins or so)

Reviews.Title: “modern,perfect and my tip for barca!”
Reviews.Author: unikat77
Reviews.Content: we got here late 28th august ..you walkt trought the restaurant kitchen that is spottless!! what a wiev (one can walk in trough different entrances) ;) hotel is about 10 min from the center, very nice staff excelent concierge and a great guide for the night life our room (812) is beautifull..maybe its the only room with a terrace ..we love it and we enjoy every moment of it.. had some great sleep-- very quite area.. doors are fun as it looks like each room is a safe itself (heavy safety doors) all that is offered works service perfect, helpfull people food is healthy tasty..so room service works well we are looking forward to the restaurant that we reserved for thusday.. and we will post all about it! spa is lovely and the massages were mmmmmmmmmm we looove it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: mij
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights at the ABaC and loved it. We stayed in the standard room, which felt better than standard. The location is away from the hustle and bustle of the central city, but only an 8 minute metro ride way. The trains come every 6-7 minutes or so. There is a tourist bus stop right outside the hotel. The Plaza Kennedy neighborhood is nice to walk around. We found a local pizza/tapas that we couldn't resist going back to multiple times. The hotel has a very intimate feel. The breakfast is great and served by a lovely lady. The staff were very helpful. Marien in particular was great. They happily arranged tickets to the theatre and La Sagrada Familia - and gave us some great tips along the way.

Reviews.Title: “"Sublime"”
Reviews.Author: 19tessa60
Reviews.Content: Having experienced four nights at the ABaC, being looked after by Marien and her team, we would not consider staying anywhere else on our return to Barcelona. The tasting menu exceeded all expectations as did the whole experience of this unique establishment. Faultless!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate. Luxurious. 1st Class Michelin starred Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: AJCG
Reviews.Content: Small hotel. North of main city. Easy access via metro 100m away from hotel. Quiet residential area. Interesting building. Stayed 3 nights in a suite at 30% of quoted "rack rate"... Would not have paid the full price! Very luxurious and comfortable room; air conditioned etc. Quirky design works most of the time. Calming environment. Superb restaurant. Well worth considering but not cheap.!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient small luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmy61Madrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Abac for a long weekend, and we were very fortunate to be upgraded to a suite room. The room was more than fantastic, very modern, very fashionable, all-white, with an understated luxury all around. The best thing, by far, is the bed. Absolutely unforgetteable. Breakfast is also very special, with all sorts of different possbilities, all very personalized. Abolutely brilliant. Couple of not-so-possitive comments: entrance to the rooms is made through the kitchen, not a good idea for a 5star hotel (even if different from any other hotel, but...). The other thing is that the hotel is far away from the city center, which is good for relax but it takes some long trip in a taxi to get into downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, intimate boutique hotel and fantastic restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Jubejubebe
Reviews.Content: Loved: Stayed for my honeymoon for 2 nights. Service was fantastic, felt very welcomed from the start to the end, the romantic getaway package came with a rose petal drawn bath with a bottle of cava, Michelin restaurant was fabulous (I took a picture of each dish) and i was pleasantly surprised by the presentation of each dish. Definitely worth the splurge. A stone's throw from the train station and yet in a nice quiet spot (good neighbourhood - no safety concerns even when we came back past 11pm), tram to Tibidablo is just the street next the hotel. Do spend sometime in the spa area for some R&R (steam bath and jacuzzi). Quality furnishing and bright room when blinds are drawn up. Luxurious Hermes toiletries (they are not stingy with providing). Beautiful bath and separate shower area. Definitely recommend Dislikes: None.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: BobRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: The service is unbelievable, the rooms large and confortable. We had a great time. Note: It's not far from the touristic areas, but you have to get a transportation to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler99
Reviews.Content: Our room at the ABaC was spectacular. The design was gorgeous, the bed linens incredible and the shower was fabulous. The room also had a lovely window seat that could be enclosed by curtains and looked out into the garden. The room was incredibly quiet and we looked out on a wall of green (we were concerned when we arrived because the street is quite busy). It was like having our own private apartment in Barcelona. The staff was wonderful and recommended fabulous restaurants and tapas bars. Our only issue was that it is a bit far from the Gothic quarter--we would have liked to be in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury 5* deluxe retreat in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: HannahVT
Reviews.Content: The ABaC Hotel is an oasis of luxury, calm, hospitality and perfection in one of the prettiest areas of Barcelona. An incredible and beautiful hotel that delivers on every level. We were met by a team of staff that are there to meet every one of your needs and more...nothing is too much trouble for Maria and her staff. We stayed in the penthouse suite with an outdoor hot-tub overlooking Mount Tibidabo. What an absolutely beautiful and romantic setting. We had this room booked for half our stay and to make it even more perfect, Maria offered us an upgrade to this room as it was simply available for the rest of our visit. You feel simply relaxed and spoilt here. After a day of shopping, sight-seeing, eating and drinking there is a tranquil thermal spa to return to and unwind at no extra cost...you feel a million miles from the hustle of the city. The hotel, rooms and bathrooms are a design success and part of the city's architectural genius. The Michelin starred restaurant at the ABaC was a master piece and definitely worth a visit if staying here or not. Some of the best food we have experienced and reminiscent of Ramsays Royal Hospital Road in London. If looking for a luxury hotel... the ABaC is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GEMD_1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ABaC for 4 nights in March 2011 and had an amazing experience. We booked the hotel based upon the fabulous reviews that we read here on TripAdvisor.com and were not disappointed. We appreciated that the hotel was conveniently located to the metro and bus lines, making sight-seeing very easy! We also appreciated that the hotel was outside the busy city center and we did not have to contend with the busy city traffic and noise -- yet found restaurants, transporation and markets within easy walking distance. We booked our Penthouse Suite room through SLH.com and were able to take advantage of a off-peak rate + a 4th night free. Our accomodation surpassed all of our expectations and the staff of the ABaC was absolutely excellent!!!! We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our stay -- from the comfortable king size bed, to the lovely roof-top deck and jaccuzi, as well as the sun-deck chairs, outdoor table/chairs, waterfall shower and spa tub. We also enjoyed a room service meal -- delivered promptly to our room for our enjoyment on the roof-top deck/patio by moonlight. Our only regret, was that we had not allowed more days to stay at the ABaC and enjoy the spa + roof-top breakfast. The staff made wonderful recommendations for dinner, like Dos Palillos, and were able to book events, such as a Spanish Guitar concert, with ease. We also enjoyed dinner in the ABaC restaurant on our final night of our stay -- which exceeded all of our expectations and was a wonderful gastronomic experience ... service, food and wine were all absolutely fabulous!! Thank you ABaC for making our stay in Barcelona one that we will never forget. We hope to return in the very near future!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little boutique hotel with an amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Leapingferret
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in May. What an amazing experience! Quirky layout in two buildings which makes sense when explained it used to be the US embassy and ambassadors residence and that they are linked through the basement. Room very high tech. and functional. The very best pillows that I have ever encountered. But all this is just a bonus, the real reason to visit the Abac is the amazing restaurant. Words cannot describe the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: DaringMiss
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I love this hotel. This past February was our second visit to the hotel in two years, and it will definitely not be our last. The rooms are great - spacious with great contemporary bathrooms - and the beds are glorious! The staff is fabulous - friendly and helpful. The restaurant on the first floor is terrific. We have tried it under both of its chefs and have enjoyed it both times. The location is great, because after your meal you will be so stuffed, you will not want to do anything but take the elevator to your room to revel in your experience. Best room in the hotel is the attic room. The room itself is not huge, but the outside deck overlooking the city with a table for intimate meals and the hot tub for late night lounging is absolutely romantic! The room is the one pictured in most of their promos and it is even better in person.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SouthAustin704
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ABaC the past week. I can't say enough about how great it is. The overall feel is very welcoming but intimate. It's in a residential part of the city, but there are enough cafes around to find a bite to eat and a great cup of coffee! Also, the metro stop is literally steps away. The ride to La Rambla is ~7 minutes. We rode it multiple times per day. The hotel is a great retreat from the action downtown. The staff is amazing from the front desk to the cleaning crew - very wonderful people. We couldn't have found a better place for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff and amazing food”
Reviews.Author: clarelucy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel ABaC for our honeymoon. 4 nights of pure bliss, the rooms were gorgeous, stylishly designed with your extreme comfort in mind. The Hermes products in the bathroom were a lovely bonus. The hotel felt like a perfect haven, set a little way back from the chaotic touristy center of Barca in Av. Tibidabo which is a refined suburb with wide leafy streets and gorgeous townhouses. The restaurant is beyond fantastic, 2 michelin stars are well deserved. Though for me the best thing about the hotel was the wonderful staff who were charming, considerate, never intrusive and supremely helpful. I can't recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BobFace
Reviews.Content: ABaC is by far the best hotel we've ever stayed in, by some margin. The location is perfect, the quiet leafy suburbs of barcelona. The staff are lovely, attentive but discrete, nothing was ever a problem. The food was amazing, one of the best meals we've ever had at the restaurants, and the breakfasts, as well as the incidental meals will b e talked about for many more years. The rooms are very well designed, refined, simple and elegant, they are not like bog standard hotel rooms; small and boxy, but light, airy and spacious. If you can afford to stay here, then you definitely should. We imagined it's what life would be like if you're Richard Branson. The hotel smells lovely, which is a minor point, but something worth mentioning. By our third day, we'd decided that it wasn't just the best hotel in Barcelona, it's probably the best place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: flymetrix
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this particular hotel. Having been to many 5 star hotels, ABAC may in fact be my one of my highest rated. The premises is an old embassy converted to a hotel space. There was no detail skipped in terms of design...very zen and sophisticated. The service was BAR none!! We felt royalty through out our stay. The rooms are well appointed and the layout is perfect. I felt like we were in our own very little BCN apt. It is very ergonomic in terms the use of the space. The location is also very convenient as it is right across the street from the train. My boyfriend and I were in Barcelona for El Clasico and since I am not a huge fan of massive crowds, I was concerned that we would end up needing a vacation from this vacation. I was wrong. The staff and service and accommodations at the ABAC truly made our trip feel luxurious and relaxing as well. THANK YOU! Eva at the ABAC was esp amazing! :) We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: brendanmountjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and wish it could have been more. There is almost a Zen like calm in the hotel grounds compared to the bustle of the streets outside. I have to say the the service we received was the best in any hotel, ever!! As the spa was unavailable we were 'compensated' with a room upgrade to a deluxe room and given complimentary breakfast which was a nice touch. Although we did not eat in the hotel restaurant (michelin star**) it looked excellent. The hotel is located very near a metro and there is a direct line to the city centre. A taxi takes about 10min but beware the driving standards are very poor and we had a few few near misses + ripped off on fares!!

Reviews.Title: “ABaC just gets so many things right its Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ewen89541
Reviews.Content: What to say...some hotels have a signature feature and the rest is just adequate at best; not ABaC. So few architects are able to apply Le Corbusier design while creating an exquisite space for people to enjoy; whoever designed this hotel was an able individual! The staff were simply excellent and so professional (especially Pilar) while at the same time friendly and engaging; If possible i would contact Marien Inigo-Schneider the Hotel Manager directly especially if you are going to stay for 5 to 7 days. Get a Chauffeur to and from the Airport arranged by the hotel; some Spanish taxi drivers think they are Alonso... The Room: Sound proofed... Aircon that works effortlessly... Huge comfortable bed... Electric remote control curtains... B&O integrated TV, DVD et al; take some DVD's & CD's to make the most of this when you are chilling out... Wifi in the rooms as well as throughout the hotel take your iPad... A bathroom / shower room that is just fantastic... Lots of storage / hanging space... Sensible amounts of bottled water in the rooms (still and sparkling); no hotels seem to do this i am still mystified why they don't; how can 5* be 5* if you are thirsty? Breakfast: So often i miss breakfast because it finishes "too early" at ABaC you only had to make it down before 11am i made it once and then never missed it. Everyday we finished off our breakfast / brunch having coffee & water on the terrace / garden outside enjoying the sun. Lunch / Room Service Menu: Even the room service food was fantastic but i suppose when you think it though the kitchen is run by a 2* chef. Dinner 2*: Make sure you book in for two evenings during your stay the first night you arrive (if you are not too tired) & the second last night of your stay. It is a fabulous dinning experience. I recommend Cava - Torre De L'Homenatge 1999 from the wine list. You now you are dinning somewhere special when you can walk thru the centre of the kitchen during service and it is spotless! Spa: A lovely space but Marien was saying she was not happy with it and further work was being planned. Barcelona: What a great city lots to do, for me though the Sagrada Familia stole the show. I actually went to see it twice; you can feel the genius. I also tried to get up the huge telecommunication tower designed by Sir Norman Foster overlooking the city but sadly it is restricted access. We can't wait to go back i may even have my 40th there...

Reviews.Title: “A cozy boutique hotel out of the hustle bustle”
Reviews.Author: Shantap
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Friendly staff, lovely rooms, architecturally interesting, romantic. I liked the location at the north end of the city, near the hiking trails up onto the hillsides above the city, and in a luxury home neighborhood of Barcelona, and yet a quick cab or subway ride into the heart of the city. Definitely deserving of the star rating, and very classy. Very small and personal feeling. Modern designs and layout. I was traveling solo, and found the bar, restaurant, and general activity level to be low in the hotel, so it was hard to meet others. I went to the spa four times and was the only person each time. I never saw others in the bar. So, unlike the other hotel I stayed in during my visit (Villa Emilia), this was better for a private, quiet, romantic visit. Villa Emilia had more action in its restaurant, bar, and rooftop area. For the price, one might have expected a workout facility attached to the spa (there is none), but there are ten euro workout options not too distant from the hotel. Also, one might have expected a pool. There is an indoor spa, but no actual swimming pool or outdoor pool options.

Reviews.Title: “state of the art, the best shower ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Carcentina
Reviews.Content: staid for 3 nights hotel only. I used to stay in 5 stars hotel and by all mean I can say this hotel has the best shower/tub ever seen....you would linger for hours under the shower! everything was perfect apart breakfast that despite being good was nothing of exceptional compared to the hotel. definetively a win choice if you look for boutique hotel and like quiteness.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of Going Back. Absolutely Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fabroni
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay in Barcelona and the Hotel Abac. Previous reviews on Tripadvisor convinced us of our choice, but even then our high expectations were exceeded. We were greeted by the hotel manager (Marien Inigo Schneider) who, despite our very early arrival (10:30 AM) had our room ready. Very welcome after a long overnight flight. After the checkin Marien gave us a very detailed synopsis of Barcelona which included sights, transportation,museums, shopping and restaurants (earlier she had e-mailed us a list of top restaurants that SHE recommended and then had made reservations for us). All I can say is that Marien is a highly knowledgeable and sophisticated person with impeccable taste. We quickly learned to seek out her advice for anything. The hotel was modern and beautifully appointed. The rooms were large with abundant drawer and closet space, a large and Extremely Comfortable bed and a huge bathroom. The rooms were cleaned at least twice a day and the chocolate bar on our pillow was a huge plus (excellent), The hotel restaurant (2 star Michelen) was an excellent choice. The tasting menu was not only delicious but also entertaining (restrained molecular with a leaning towards local foods and respect with Catalan cuisine). The wine list and sommelier were both excellent and the overall service matched he two star rating. However the highlight and most enjoyable moments at Hotel Abac was the breakfast. Abundant (too much actually) and beautifully prepared and served by the delightful Pilar (who I wanted to kidnap and bring back home with us). Our only concern was that the hotel was 3 Km. from the center. This turned out to be and advantage as the subway entrance, taxi stand and bus stop were all at the hotel entrance and the center of town less than ten minutes away....even late at night. I, for one, cannot wait to come back to Barcelona and the Hotel Abac. P.S. If you have the opportunity take the train and go to Sant Pol de Mar for lunch at Restaurant Sant Pau. Once in a lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “ABaC - wonderful restaurant and hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoodleStroodle
Reviews.Content: The ABaC Hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Fantastic design, clean and modern with friendly staff. The beds were probably the most comfortable we have ever slept on and the children were delighted to find the room came equipped with iPad and the most enormous TV in the world! Our only slight disappointment was we couldn't find anywhere to dock iPod to listen to music in the room. Spa is lovely. Staff very friendly and helpful. The ABaC Restaurant is quite fantastic. Other people on the site have said that it is stuffy - it is not stuffy in a pompous way but smart as befits a restaurant at these prices and this type of cooking. We had two teenagers with us who absolutely loved it and did not feel over awed. Wonderful meal - flavours that defy belief - basil sorbet - theatrical smoke filled domes - de-constructed cappuccino - friendly sommelier too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, very peaceful and extremely relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cha1984
Reviews.Content: I visited the Abac hotel for 2 nights and was not disappointed at all. We were greeted by the lovely Maria who made us feel very special. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was to die for! The beds were so comfortable and the rain shower was truly spectacular. The bedroom felt like no oen else had ever slept there before. We ate in the hotel on our first night, the food was delicious though a little pricey, however we did get treated very well. This was a fantastic experience and I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a peaceful holiday, not in the touristy part like Las Ramblas, and those who want to indulge a little.
